comment: Professor Manguno is a great professor who listens to feedback and respects his students. He is very lecture heavy and attendance is mandatory, however he is very understanding to circumstances and is easily reached outside of class. He is prompt with emails. Sometimes his directions can be vague but he is ready to answer all questions as you need.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Went off the rails with his schedule so we never knew what was due or when. Doesn't explain much and expects you to know everything after the first time. His expectations go against what you learn in previous classes. Gives points back if you argue your case well. Every test is short answer and he gives the material a day before. Experienced.

Manguno is fantastic! He has so much experience in the field, so he knows his stuff. However, if you're looking for an easy A, don't take him. He is very particular and edits your work like it would be in a newsroom. He gives great feedback and is available to help after hours. There will be a lot of writing!
Very good professor. Patient and helpful. Very precise, but I really enjoy his class!
Highly knowledgeable and experienced. Demanding, but faire.
I feel as though I did not learn much in the class and if I do pass I may take it again anyway just to get a better understanding of the subject.

I am very interested in the material being taught, but Manguno was intolerable. I've never withdrawn from a class in my entire college career, so this one counts as my first. I'm all for classes being difficult. It's college...I expect that and I WANT to learn. Manguno was extremely unclear with his teachings to the point where it was unacceptable.
please do not take this professor! He is so awful and it is for your own good to pick any professor other than him!!
He is the worst teacher I have had at KSU. He says one thing and then goes against it the next day. He does not follow what the previous teachers have taught. Literally the worst.

WORST PROFESSOR. absolutely has no idea how to teach a college course. overloads with information and expects his students to sit and listen to his oral lectures daily and know everything he has said. RIDICULOUS!!!

This was Manguno's 1st semester teaching Photojournalism, so maybe he'll get better. But my experience was horrible. Unclear, horrible communicator, holds us responsible for what he forgets to tell us, can be rude/condescending, assigns us textbook reading yet still spent the ENTIRE 3hr class READING IT TO US. No hands-on work. Waste of time/$$.
